description: Run a sql command on a cluster

host.description: The server host and port number to connect to. This can be the address of any node in the cluster.

port.description: The server port to connect to. Note: The port number can also be specified via --host.

user.description: The SQL user that will own the client session.

certs_dir.description: The path to the certificate directory containing the CA and client certificates and client key.

url.description: A connection URL to use instead of the other arguments.

database.description: A database name to use as current database in the newly created session.

echo_sql.description: Reveal the SQL statements sent implicitly by the command-line utility.

execute.description: Execute SQL statements directly from the command line, without opening a shell.

format.description: A o use instead of the other arguments.

safe_updates.description: A o use instead of the other arguments.

set.description: A o use instead of the other arguments.
